title: The truth about my love life
self_text: I'm a transsexual and I've been dating my boyfriend for the last six months. He knows all about me, but he doesn't know that I have sex with other people. We were both drunk at a party and I ended up sleeping with his friend. I didn't tell him because I was afraid of what he would think. But now I feel guilty and I don't know what to do. Should I tell him? Or should I just keep it to myself? I'm scared of losing him.

title: Found an interesting video on YouTube about the effects of drinking too much beer
self_text: You'll never find a more beautiful place to be than here in the kitchen, next to my mom and dad, while we're all enjoying some delicious homemade beer. But if you drink too much beer, you'll end up with a bad hangover, which is why I only drink two beers per day. So please don't drink too much beer, unless you want to end up like me, with a bad headache and a stomachache. And if you do end up with a bad headache and a stomachache, just remember that it's all worth it for the taste of delicious homemade beer.

title: I need a fucking girlfriend
self_text: I need a fucking girlfriend, and like not someone who just wants to be friends, I want someone who loves me and wants to be with me. I'm so tired of being alone, I don't know what to do anymore. I don't even know how to get a girlfriend, it's so hard when you're shy and awkward. I wish there was some kind of magic spell or something that could just make someone fall in love with me. It's so unfair that some people have no problem finding love while others struggle for their entire lives. I feel like I'm going to die alone, surrounded by cats and books. I'm starting to lose hope that I'll ever find someone who truly cares about me. I just want to be loved, is that too much to ask? I'm so lonely and depressed, I can't even enjoy my hobbies anymore because all I can think about is how much I want a girlfriend. I've tried everything, dating apps, speed dating, joining clubs, but nothing seems to work. I'm starting to think that maybe I'm just not meant to be loved. I guess I'll just have to accept my fate and live a solitary life. But it's so hard, I just want to hold someone close and feel their warmth. I want to share my life with someone, laugh together, cry together, and grow old together. Is that too much to ask? I don't understand why this is happening to me. I'm a good person, I'm kind, intelligent, and funny. I have a lot to offer, but nobody seems to notice. I'm starting to feel invisible, like I don't even exist. I'm losing my mind, I can't take this anymore. I need help, I need guidance, I need a miracle. Please, someone, anyone, tell me what I'm doing wrong. I'm desperate, I'm willing to try anything. I just want to be happy, I just want to be loved.

title: The end is nigh
self_text: What a mess we’ve made. I think it would be best if we all just sat down, shut up, and let the government decide what to do about climate change. If you can’t trust your government, who can you trust? (The same people who got us into this mess in the first place)  I think it would be best if we all just sit down, shut up, and let them decide what to do about this issue. Who are we to question their authority? We are only citizens! They know better than us! It's not like they're going to screw things up for their own personal gain or anything...  Are we really gonna let these corrupt politicians run our lives forever?  No!  We must take back control of our planet.  But how?  That’s where I come in.  I have a plan.  A plan so simple yet so brilliant that it will make you question everything you thought you knew about climate change.  My plan involves… (drumroll please)…   Nuclear power plants. Yes, you heard me right. Nuclear power plants. We need more nuclear power plants. Lots of them. Everywhere. We should build them on top of mountains, under the ocean, even inside volcanoes.  It doesn’t matter where we put them. As long as they produce electricity, we’re good.  Sure, there might be some risks involved. But those risks are minimal compared to the risk of doing nothing. And besides, we can always cover up any accidents with propaganda and misinformation.  And don’t worry about the radioactive waste. We can just dump it into the ocean. No one will ever notice. Or maybe we can shoot it into space. That sounds fun.  So what do you say? Are you with me? Let’s save the world together. With nuclear power plants.  What could possibly go wrong?  P.S. title: A true story about my friend's dad's car (NSFW)
self_text: My friend told me a true story about his dad's car the other day. His dad used to have a really nice sports car, but he didn't like it much because he had to be careful while driving it and couldn't drive fast. So he decided to buy a truck instead. He liked that he could go as fast as he wanted without worrying about damaging the vehicle, and he was able to haul things around with it. But then one day, while he was driving home from work, he got into an accident. He wasn't hurt, but his truck was totaled. He went to the junkyard to get his stuff out of the truck, and he noticed something strange. There were several people standing around the truck, looking at it. He asked them what they were doing, and they said they were trying to figure out how to get the engine out. He told them that he was the owner of the truck, and they all apologized for snooping around. They explained that they were mechanics who were interested in seeing the engine. They said that the engine was very rare and valuable, and they would pay him a lot of money for it. He agreed to sell them the engine, and they gave him cash on the spot. He took the money and bought himself another truck. This time, he decided to buy a different kind of truck. He bought a pickup truck with a big engine and four-wheel drive. He loved this truck, and he drove it everywhere. One day, while he was driving down the highway, he saw a familiar face. It was one of the mechanics who had bought his engine. He pulled over to say hello, and the mechanic told him that he had just finished rebuilding the engine. He said that it was now even more powerful than it had been before. He offered to let him take it for a spin. He accepted the offer, and he was amazed by the power of the engine. He thanked the mechanic for letting him try it out, and he drove away. As he was driving home, he started to think about everything that had happened. He realized that he had made a mistake by selling the engine. He should have kept it and rebuilt it himself. He also realized that he had learned a valuable lesson. He learned that sometimes, you need to take risks in order to achieve your goals. And he learned that sometimes, the best way to learn is to make mistakes. The next day, he went back to the junkyard and asked if they had any other engines for sale. They did, and he bought one. He spent the next few months rebuilding the engine, and he finally finished it. He put the engine in his truck, and he drove it everywhere. He loved his truck, and he never regretted buying it. The end.

title: The Holy Bible - Genesis 1:27-31 (KJV)
self_text: And God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them. And God blessed them, and God said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it: and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every living thing that moveth upon the earth. And God said, Behold, I have given you every herb bearing seed, which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree in the which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for meat. And to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the air, and to every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth, wherein there is life, I have given every green herb for food: and it was so. And God saw every thing that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. And the evening and the morning were the sixth day.

title: I am an evil and malicious person.

title: I need to ask you something, as a person who is into the same things as me.
self_text: As a kid growing up in the 1980s and 1990s, I have always been fascinated by the military, especially those that were part of the Cold War era. The Soviet Union was my favorite country, but I also liked China, North Korea, Cuba, Vietnam, and other countries that opposed the United States. But what if these countries had never existed? What if there had never been any wars or conflicts between them and the West? Or even worse, what if they had won? Would we be living in a world where communism was dominant, and democracy was just a distant memory? How would our lives be different?  I know it sounds like a crazy thought experiment, but sometimes I can't help but wonder about these scenarios. It’s not that I want communism to win, it's just that I am curious about how the world would be different if it did. If there was no World War II, there wouldn’t have been an occupation of Japan, Korea, Germany, Austria, Italy, France, Belgium, Netherlands, Poland, Czechoslovakia, Romania, Bulgaria, Hungary, Albania, Yugoslavia, Greece, Norway, Denmark, Luxembourg, Ireland, Portugal, Spain, Finland, Russia, Ukraine, Belarus, Lithuania, Latvia, Estonia, Moldova, Georgia, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan, and many more countries!  It seems like every time someone asks me why I love communism so much, I end up rambling about how the Soviet Union was cool because it stood up to America, which I think is a terrible thing to say. And I don't even believe in communism anymore. So maybe I should stop talking about it altogether. What do you think?

title: I am not an animal
self_text: I’m the only human on earth who doesn't own a pet. I’ve never had a pet in my life and I don’t plan to have any. Pets are nothing but animals. Animals are disgusting. They smell, they shed, they poop, they pee everywhere, they get sick and need expensive vet care, they chew up your furniture and your shoes, they bite you when you try to touch them, they wake you up at night with their incessant barking or meowing, they lick themselves in public, they leave hair all over everything, they require constant attention, and they die and then you have to grieve for them like they were people. It’s ridiculous. If you want companionship, get a friend. If you want something to take care of, get a plant. But if you want an animal, go to the zoo.  I think that pets make people stupid. Why would anyone spend so much time and money on an animal? That money could be used for more important things, like education, travel, or investing. And why would anyone let an animal control their life? People who have pets always talk about their pets and how great they are. It’s annoying. They treat their pets like children, dressing them up in clothes, taking them out to eat, and even pushing them in strollers. It’s pathetic.  And what happens when you go on vacation? You have to pay someone to come to your house every day to feed and walk your pet. Or you have to take your pet with you, which is even worse. Imagine trying to find a hotel that allows pets. It’s a nightmare.  I just don’t understand the appeal of having a pet. They’re messy, smelly, and demanding. They’re nothing but trouble. I’m better off without one.  In fact, I hate animals.  They’re dirty, dumb, and dangerous.  I wouldn’t trust one as far as I can throw it.  And I wouldn’t want one anywhere near me.  So please, keep your pets away from me.  I don’t want to catch anything from them.  Or get bitten by them.  Or have to smell them.  Just keep them away from me.  Thank you.

title: The story of the time I ate a live chicken 🐔
self_text: I was walking down the street when I saw a man selling chickens. He had them in a cage and they were all flapping their wings and clucking. I asked him how much they cost, and he said $5 each. I bought one and walked away. As I was walking, I started to feel hungry. I looked at the chicken and thought, "Why not?" So I grabbed it by the legs and stuffed its head into my mouth. It was still alive and flapping around, but I just kept chewing. It tasted like chicken, but with more feathers. After I finished eating the chicken, I felt really sick. I threw up on the sidewalk and then passed out. When I woke up, I was in a hospital bed. The doctor told me that I had food poisoning from the raw chicken. I spent the next few days in the hospital recovering. I learned my lesson: don't eat live chickens.

title: I'M SO LATE FOR MY MATH CLASS!
self_text: I have a test today and it's gonna be so hard.  I haven't been to class for like a week and my professor is super strict and doesn't let people make up tests, so if I miss this one I'm gonna fail the course.   The thing is I woke up really late and now I'm running super late.  I don't even know where my math classroom is at anymore since I haven't been there in so long. I tried asking some students but they all just looked at me funny and kept walking. I ran into a few of my friends but they were all busy going to their classes and didn't have time to help me.  I was starting to freak out when I saw my TA, who said that my classroom was on the other side of campus.  I started running as fast as I could, weaving through crowds of students and dodging backpacks. Finally, I made it to my building, only to realize I forgot my calculator at home. This is a disaster. I need my calculator for the test or else I'm gonna fail. I ran back to my dorm room, grabbed my calculator, and raced back to school again. By the time I got to my classroom, the test had already started and everyone was halfway done. I apologized to my professor for being late and he glared at me before letting me sit down.  I took the test, but I knew I did terribly. I forgot a lot of the material and I made stupid mistakes because I was so stressed out. I'm pretty sure I failed.  I'm so upset with myself for waking up late and not being prepared. This is a mess.

title: The new and improved way to get rid of spam bots. (2015-12-26)
self_text: Spam bots are a scourge on the internet, but they can be easily defeated by simply ignoring them. This is because spam bots are programmed to respond to any kind of input, even if it's just silence. By refusing to engage with them, we can effectively starve them of the attention they crave and render them harmless.  In fact, studies have shown that spam bots are actually more likely to give up and go away when they are ignored. So next time you encounter a spam bot, don't bother responding. Just ignore it and let it fade into oblivion.

title: Found the problem with the new Xbox Series X console, so here is my theory...
self_text: So I have a couple of theories about why people are getting that black screen on their Xbox Series X consoles when they turn them on for the first time. My first theory is that it's caused by a bug in the operating system. The OS needs to be updated before you can use the console and if there is a glitch during that process, then the console might get stuck in a boot loop.  The second theory is that the console isn't able to connect to the internet. This could be due to a bad wifi connection or an issue with your network settings. If the console can't connect to the internet, it won't be able to download the necessary updates and will get stuck in a boot loop.  And the third theory is that the console has a hardware defect. This could be anything from a faulty power supply to a broken motherboard. If the console has a hardware defect, it might not be able to boot up properly.  I think the most likely cause of the problem is a bug in the operating system. But it's also possible that the console isn't able to connect to the internet or that it has a hardware defect.  If you're experiencing this problem, try restarting your console several times. If that doesn't work, try resetting your network settings. And if that still doesn't work, contact Microsoft support.

title: A good start
self_text:
“I can’t wait to see how you all grow, and what kind of people you become,” I said as I smiled at the children in front of me. 

They stared back at me with a blank expression. 

“You guys are so young and full of potential,” I continued, “I know that whatever path you choose, you will make your mark on this world.” 

One of the kids spoke up. 

“We don’t want to do any of that. We just want to go home.” 

My smile faded. 

“What?” I asked. 

“We don’t want to be anyone special. We don’t want to change the world. We just want to go home and play video games.” 

I was speechless. These were the future leaders of tomorrow? The ones who would shape the destiny of our nation? They couldn’t even muster up enough enthusiasm to pretend to care about making a difference. 

I sighed. 

“Fine,” I said. “Go home.” 

As they ran off, I watched them disappear into the distance. 

Maybe it was for the best. Maybe the world didn’t need more leaders. Maybe it just needed more people who knew how to have fun. 

But still…it hurt. It really hurt.

title: I have a serious question for everyone on Reddit

Or would they just continue swimming around in the dark until they ran out of oxygen? And what about the plants? Would they still be able to photosynthesize without the sun? Or would they just slowly wither away and die? And what about the animals that eat those plants? Would they starve to death? And what about the animals that eat those animals? Would they also starve to death? And what about us? Would we all just sit around waiting for the end of the world? Or would we try to do something about it? Like, maybe build a giant spaceship and fly to another star? Or maybe just go crazy and start killing each other? I don't know, I'm just trying to wrap my head around this whole thing. It's really scary when you think about it. But hey, at least we'd all be together, right?

The prosecution argued that Masterson used his position within the Church of Scientology to intimidate victims into silence and avoid accountability for his actions. However, the overwhelming evidence presented at the second trial suggests that he is guilty of the crimes he was charged with. It is important to note that the allegations against Masterson are serious and disturbing. Sexual assault is a crime that causes significant harm to victims, and it should not be taken lightly. While some may disagree with the outcome of the trial, it is crucial to respect the legal process and the decisions made by the jury. title: The Truth About How To Get a Better Body (Without Having to Work Hard)
self_text: I’m just going to come out and say it… the fitness industry is full of shit. It doesn’t want you to get results, because if you do, they lose money. They want you to buy their products, their programs, their meal plans, their supplements, their gym memberships, and all the other stuff that will make them rich while you stay fat and miserable.  But what if I told you there was a way to get in shape without having to work hard? What if I told you there was a way to build muscle, lose fat, and feel great without spending hours at the gym or eating bland, tasteless food? Well, there is. And it’s called biohacking. Biohacking is simply using science and technology to improve your body and mind. It’s about understanding how your body works and then finding ways to optimize it.  Here are some things you can do to start biohacking your body today:  1. Sleep more. This is the most important thing you can do for your health. When you sleep, your body repairs itself and builds muscle. If you don’t get enough sleep, you’ll be tired, stressed, and less able to focus.  2. Eat healthy foods. This should be obvious, but it’s worth repeating. Eating processed foods, sugar, and unhealthy fats will sabotage your efforts to get in shape. Instead, focus on eating whole, unprocessed foods like fruits, vegetables, lean protein, and healthy fats.  3. Exercise regularly. You don’t need to spend hours at the gym to get fit. Just 30 minutes of moderate exercise each day can make a big difference.  4. Take supplements. There are many supplements that can help you improve your health and performance. Some good options include creatine, whey protein, and vitamin D.  5. Use technology. There are many technologies available that can help you track your progress and optimize your health. Some examples include fitness trackers, sleep monitors, and brainwave sensors.  Biohacking isn’t just about getting in shape. It’s about taking control of your health and well-being. It’s about optimizing your body and mind so you can live your best life.  If you’re ready to take control of your health, I encourage you to learn more about biohacking. There are many resources available online and in libraries.  And remember, the key to success is to start small and be consistent. Don’t try to change everything overnight. Just pick one or two things to focus on and gradually add more over time.  You’ll be surprised at how much better you feel when you start taking care of yourself.

title: I'm making a fanfic of my favorite anime...
self_text: The premise is that the main character gets transported to our world by an alien, and has to help me finish writing his story before he can go back home. But here's where it gets complicated. He doesn't know what any of these words mean. Here's some of the dialogue from chapter 1: "I don't understand what you want me to do," the boy said, shaking his head in confusion. "You want me to write about myself?" I laughed nervously. "Well, yeah, but not like a diary entry or anything. I want you to tell me about your life." The boy frowned. "My life? What does that even mean?" "Your experiences! Your feelings!" I exclaimed, trying to be encouraging. The boy paused for a moment, then spoke slowly, "But I don't have any feelings. I'm just a robot." My jaw dropped. "A robot?! You're telling me you're a robot?!" "Yes," the boy replied matter-of-factly. "I was created by Dr. Wily to destroy Mega Man." I stared at him in disbelief. "Dr. Wily? Mega Man? Are you kidding me?" The boy shook his head. "No. It's true. I am Proto Man, the evil brother of Mega Man." I sighed. This was going to be harder than I thought. "Okay, okay," I said, trying to regain my composure. "Let's start with something simple. What do you like to do for fun?" The boy tilted his head. "Fun? What is 'fun'?" I groaned. This was going nowhere. "Never mind," I said. "Just tell me about your powers." The boy smiled. "Oh, I have lots of powers. I can shoot lasers from my eyes, fly through the air, and teleport anywhere in the world." I raised an eyebrow. "Teleport anywhere in the world?" "Yes," the boy replied proudly. "I can even teleport to other dimensions." I blinked. "Other dimensions?" "Yes," the boy said. "I once teleported to a dimension where everyone was made of cheese." I burst out laughing. "Cheese?! That's ridiculous!" The boy shrugged. "It was a very cheesy dimension." I couldn't stop laughing. This was the most absurd conversation I had ever had. And yet, somehow, it was also incredibly inspiring. I knew that this fanfic was going to be amazing.

title: The true story of how I became the biggest loser on Reddit
self_text: Well, I'm just a simple man with a simple life and very few friends but they are not my friends anymore because I have been banned from all social media sites for posting NSFW content on them and I'm now being hunted by the FBI so I decided to go into hiding in a basement and start playing video games. After about three months I got bored so I started making videos of myself playing video games and uploading them to YouTube. After about six months I had a million subscribers and was making enough money to pay my rent and buy food. But then I got greedy and started making videos that were more explicit than before. And that's when the FBI came knocking. Now I'm on the run again and trying to stay one step ahead of the law. It's not easy, but I'm determined to make it through.

title: The greatest achievement of mankind is not the invention of the wheel, or electricity, or even fire, but to make it so that every person on earth can be an internet troll.
self_text: I have been thinking about this for a while now and I'm convinced that the greatest achievement of mankind is not the invention of the wheel, or electricity, or even fire, but to make it so that every person on earth can be an internet troll.  I mean think about it. For millennia, humanity has been working towards making life easier and more comfortable. We've built cities, created art, explored the universe. But all of these things pale in comparison to the sheer power and reach of online trolling.  With just a few clicks, you can torment strangers from across the globe. You can spread misinformation, incite hatred, and generally make everyone's lives miserable. And best of all, you can do it anonymously!  It's truly remarkable. No other technology allows us to inflict such widespread pain and suffering with so little effort.  And the best part is, it's all perfectly legal (in most cases).  So yeah, I think we should all take a moment to appreciate what we've accomplished. We've created a world where anyone can be a troll. That's something to be proud of.

title: The most annoying thing about the internet
self_text: Is that you can’t make a sound in there without somebody trying to put a label on it and sell it back to you. Like some kind of digital black market for your soul. It's like, "Oh, you have thoughts? That'll be $40." I just want to sit here quietly with my own thoughts, but no, people gotta come along and monetize everything. Even my feelings.

title: The 2nd biggest problem with the US military is its reliance on "war games" for training, while the Russian military trains in real war situations...
self_text: >The 2nd biggest problem with the US military is its reliance on "war games" for training, while the Russian military trains in real war situations... War games are fun but they don't prepare you for the horrors of a real battlefield. They also give false confidence and encourage recklessness. I think that if the US had been more serious about its training, then it would have won both Iraq and Afghanistan.  War games are a waste of time and money. They don't teach soldiers anything useful. They just make them feel good about themselves.  I think that the US military should stop wasting time and money on war games and start focusing on real-world training. If we want to win our wars, we need to train like we fight. That means getting out there and fighting! I am a veteran who served in Iraq and Afghanistan. I saw firsthand how unprepared our troops were for the realities of combat. It was a disaster.  We lost so many lives because our soldiers didn't know what they were doing. We need to do better.  We need to train our troops for the real world.  We need to get rid of these ridiculous war games and start focusing on real-world training.  I hope this helps.

title: A funny thing happened at the bank today.
self_text: I went to a bank and asked to withdraw $20,000 in $100 bills. The cashier looked at me as if I was crazy. "Sir," she said, "do you realize that is quite a large sum of money?" "Yes, ma'am," I replied, "but it's my money." She paused for a moment and then said, "Well, sir, do you have any idea what you would do with that much cash?" "Yes, ma'am," I said, "I'm going to go to Las Vegas." "Las Vegas?" she exclaimed. "What are you planning on doing in Las Vegas?" "I'm going to gamble," I said. "Gamble?" she said. "What kind of gambling?" "I'm going to play blackjack," I said. "Blackjack?" she said. "Do you know how to play blackjack?" "Yes, ma'am," I said. "I've been playing blackjack for years." "Well, sir," she said, "I hope you win." "Thank you," I said. "I appreciate that." She counted out the money and handed it to me. As I was leaving, I heard her say to another cashier, "I can't believe he's going to Las Vegas with $20,000!" I turned around and smiled at her. "Don't worry," I said, "I'll send you a postcard." And I did. A few weeks later, I received a postcard from her. It said, "Dear Sir, Thank you for the postcard. I hope you had a good time in Las Vegas. Sincerely, The Cashier"

title: Found the source of my depression.
self_text: I think it's the fact that I have a mother who thinks she is better than me and always puts me down in front of people, a brother who has been stealing from me since I was six years old, and a father who doesn't give a fuck about anything except his precious car. I just wish they would stop making me feel like shit every time I try to do something good with my life.
